image.altText: Bell resigns thumbnail

props.synopsis: Jimmy Barnes is among more than 40 music voices supporting an open letter to the embattled Australian National University (ANU) calling for the School of Music to be saved.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes among stars calling for change at ANU

image.altText: Neville Bonner in bronze.

props.synopsis: Neville Bonner is honoured as Australia's first Indigenous parliamentarian.

title.children: First Indigenous parliamentarian commemorated with bronze sculpture

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a suit holds a framed image of a young woman to his chest outside a courthouse.

props.synopsis: The father of a 22-year-old woman who died after her motorbike collided with a bus earlier this year has given emotional statement outside court, as the bus driver is spared jail for negligent driving causing death.

title.children: 'No sentence can bring my daughter back': Bus driver spared jail over crash

image.altText: An older man with white hair gets out of the driver's side of a car.

props.synopsis: Bishop Pat Power is being remembered as a much-loved Canberran who leaves a legacy of compassion and hope.

title.children: 'Supporter for the marginalised': Tireless campaigner Bishop Pat Power dies

image.altText: A man holding and smiling at a small child.

props.synopsis: For many Nepalese families living in Canberra, the arrival of parents from overseas is both a helping hand with raising children and a connection to their homeland.

title.children: The 10,000km journey grandparents are taking to share their culture

image.altText: A team of men in matching green rugby jerseys stands in a group in front of a large winners plaque.

props.synopsis: Two weeks ago, the Canberra Raiders won the NRL's 2025 minor premiership by beating the Wests Tigers. It is their first minor premiership since 1990, and a lot has changed since then.

title.children: How things have changed since the Canberra Raiders last won a minor premiership

image.altText: A young caucasian man wearing a green shirt smiles

props.synopsis: Key moments that led to the identification and arrest of the man accused of murdering Charlie Kirk have been laid out in fresh court documents released by US authorities.

title.children: Alleged Charlie Kirk killer's confession to lover revealed in text messages

image.altText: A white tent with "American Comeback Tour" written on it is seen behind police tape and a uniformed officer.

props.synopsis: US police have charged a 71-year-old man they say has admitted to yelling out that he shot conservative activist Charlie Kirk in order to "allow the actual suspect to flee".

title.children: Man admits he claimed to be Charlie Kirk gunman so real suspect could flee

image.altText: Graphic of child looking at a screen with the logos of all social media companies with squiggles in the background.

props.synopsis: The social media saga has produced its fair share of intrigue. But the latest big reveal on how the ban will work has left us with just another cliffhanger.

title.children: There's a chance you won't even notice the teen social media ban. Here's why

image.altText: A tractor and trucks piled high with belongings on a dirt road with blue sky

props.synopsis: Israeli troops encircle Gaza City as the UN chief slams the offensive as "systematic destruction", with thousands of Palestinians unable or unwilling to flee.

title.children: Israel 'burning' Gaza, defence chief says, as army deepens ground assault

image.altText: A mine and train.

props.synopsis: One of Queensland's biggest coal miners says it does not want to see jobs lost but blamed "the Queensland government's unsustainable coal royalties and market conditions".

title.children: BHP alliance to sack 750 workers blaming Qld mining royalties

image.altText: A close up of Sussan Ley.

props.synopsis: In her first major economic speech, the opposition leader hits out at universal subsidies and says "dependency" has affected Australia's "national character".

title.children: Australians too dependent on government, says Sussan Ley

image.altText: A light brown beetle and smaller brown larvae pictured in a microscopic picture with grains of rice in background.

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating how khapra beetle, the number-one-priority pest for the grains industry, entered Australia.

title.children: Major threat to Australian grains industry found in imported nappy pants

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The US president has been given something no other world leader has ever received: a second state visit invitation from Buckingham Palace. But assessing the trip's success means looking beneath the pomp and pageantry.

title.children: Royals have given Trump something no other world leader has received

image.altText: Peter Bol in the 800m heat in the middle of the pack at the Athletics World Championships.

props.synopsis: Peter Bol finished fourth in the 800 metres at Tokyo's National Stadium four years after doing the same thing at the Olympic Games, but the results could not have been more different.

title.children: Australia's athletics renaissance 'scary and exciting' for Peter Bol

image.altText: The words "FEDERAL RESERVE" engraved on a stone building.

props.synopsis: The world's largest central bank is less than 24 hours from announcing one of the most anticipated interest rate decisions of the year.

title.children: Federal Reserve stares down worst-case scenario: US economy in stagflation

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has closed down after a negative session on Wall Street ahead of tomorrow's Federal Reserve decision, while BHP will sack 750 workers in its Queensland coal division. Look back on the day's business and finance news.

title.children: ASX closes down, as BHP axes 750 jobs — as it happened

image.altText: Customers browse items at David Jones

props.synopsis: Two and a half million Australians have signed up for this cashback app, which leaves them wondering what's next.

title.children: What we know about Cashrewards's abrupt shutdown

image.altText: Bell resigns thumbnail

props.synopsis: Jimmy Barnes is among more than 40 music voices supporting an open letter to the embattled Australian National University (ANU) calling for the School of Music to be saved.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes among stars calling for change at ANU

image.altText: A man sits in an office with a pen in his mouth.

props.synopsis: The Hollywood icon leaves a legacy of classic films with a career that stretched over decades.

title.children: Looking back at some of Robert Redford's most notable movies from the 1960s to the late 2010s

image.altText: A young man wearing a blue shirt and sunglasses outside the local court

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Director of Public Prosecutions is considering whether to appeal a decision to allow a young fatal hit-and-run driver who bragged to his friends afterwards to avoid jail time.

title.children: Fatal hit-run driver condemned for bragging about running men down

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: The expansion of the scheme, which allows first home buyers to purchase a property with as little as a 5 per cent deposit, has some warning it will also inflate the market. Here's what you'll need to be earning to get a foot in the door.

title.children: Here's who is eligible for an expanded first home scheme. Hint: it's not many

image.altText: An army tank that vaguely resembles a bulldozer amongst Queensland bushland.

props.synopsis: The arrival of new army capabilities shook homes throughout a north Queensland city this month. Now residents can see what they felt.

title.children: Army shows new equipment after shaking homes in initial test

image.altText: Eight greyhounds race down a sand track at Cannington.

props.synopsis: Animal advocates call on the WA government to follow the lead of other jurisdictions and phase out greyhound racing, as a state parliamentary inquiry examines the sport.

title.children: 'It's just wrong': Vet nurse calls out greyhound racing amid inquiry

image.altText: Animal scientist and biotechnologist Alison Van Eenennaam standing in a cattle yard with two young bulls on either side of her.

props.synopsis: Disease-resistant pigs, faster-growing fish and heat-tolerant cows are among a new class of animals that are being genetically engineered for the dining table. Similar meat products could soon be sold in Australia without lengthy regulatory testing.

title.children: How gene-edited fish and meat is entering our food chains

image.altText: A man looks into the camera

props.synopsis: Brett Daniel Taylor is accused of trafficking veterinary drugs to Queenslanders for assisted dying. The ABC can reveal he is separately being prosecuted for engaging in legal practice when not entitled.

title.children: Qld man accused of assisting suicides also allegedly posed as lawyer

image.altText: Allan Sumner has short dark hair, he wears glasses and a black jumper. He holds large bird feather, overlooking beaching solemnl

props.synopsis: First Nations South Australians say the harmful algal bloom impacting the state's coastline is a cultural emergency, as it continues to devastate beaches.

title.children: First Nations say they are being left out of the algal bloom conversation

image.altText: A bus in traffic with a Coronation Drive sign in the background.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane city council's anti-sprawl plan will see zoning reviewed to allow for more housing to be built close to existing transport hubs.

title.children: Brisbane to allow more high density housing near suburban shopping centres

image.altText: A barnacle-encrusted ship wheel on the sea floor next to the wreckage of an ancient ship.

props.synopsis: The F J King cargo schooner vessel was found at the bottom of Lake Michigan, 140 years after it was believed to have sunk in a ferocious storm.

title.children: Divers discover 'ghost ship' wreckage 140 years after sinking in US lake

image.altText: Water-sodden cane fields.

props.synopsis: Huge rainfall totals of more than 300 millimetres have taken even rain-hardened Far North Queenslanders by surprise at a typically drier time of the year.

title.children: Heavy rain, flash flood warning for Far North Qld

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: About 400 educators were issued prohibition orders banning them from early education or care in the past five years, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Parents kept in the dark over hundreds of blacklisted childcare workers

image.altText: Luigi Mangione, a man in his late 20s, walking in a prison jumpsuit, guided by two armed officers.

props.synopsis: The 27-year-old Ivy League graduate still faces New York state second-degree murder charges and a federal death penalty prosecution.

title.children: Judge dismisses terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione

image.altText: Mid shot of a farmer walking through waist high crop as the sun sets in the background

props.synopsis: Shifting growing seasons, interruptions to supply chains from increased natural disasters and damage to crops and livestock from extreme heat have been identified as key threats to food supply in a warmer climate.

title.children: Report exposes 'extremely concerning' risk to food supply as climate warms

image.altText: a Rainbow Bee-Eater bird

props.synopsis: Conservationists say one of the country's largest colonies of a protected native bird is under threat at a two-day festival site.

title.children: Two-day festival to go ahead on protected bird's nesting site

image.altText: A selfie of a young woman in a surgical gown and cap smiling, with her other hand she's giving the caamera a thumbs up.

props.synopsis: Chloe Rykers says her "big boobs" had, in various ways, made her career harder and left her feeling uncomfortable and in pain.

title.children: 'It held me back’: How a breast reduction changed my quality of life
